We really enjoyed the hour we spent today on a wet, gray mid-September afternoon having a cuppa and a ham sandwich at the outside tables of Locke Bar. The tea was just as tea should be — strong enough to trot a mouse across it, as the Irish used to day. And the sandwiches were well-made and generous.

In addition, the young woman who greeted us inside at the bar and took our order couldn't have been nicer, and the woman who brought our tea and sandwiches to us was equally cordial and smiling. The interior of Locke Bar is classic pub, dark, lots of beautiful woodwork, gleaming spigots for dispensing Guiness and other beers. Altogether a first-rate pub in the heart of Limerick's old city.

formatted_address: 51 Thomas St, Prior's-Land, Limerick, V94 EPR2, Ireland
review_text:
First time ordering from here after hearing a lot about it. I know there are two chains and this one is newer, but honestly, if you’re going to do Mexican food, you need to do it properly.

If you’re going to open a place and charge restaurant prices, then do the food properly. Being a new business isn’t an excuse for missing ingredients or poor assembly. It’s very frustrating there is not one good Mexican restaurant around Limerick City bar Republic Grill, even though there not the best either but nothing has topped them yet in my opinion. I would have been better off to order boojum.

I ordered a burrito bowl and a lot of what I requested was missing. There were literally two jalapeños, so I had to add my own. The bowl itself was alright, but missing key ingredients, no beans at all, very little sour cream, and the avocado was hidden underneath everything and used very sparingly for the price. I also had to add my own cheese and jalapeños, which defeats the whole point of ordering out.

I like my food hot, so I had to reheat it but once you heat lettuce, it’s not nice. That’s on me for choosing lettuce, but it’s something I wouldn’t get again.

The dos tacos were nothing special and weren’t prepared properly at all. They were lopsided, poorly assembled, and arrived cold. Cold tacos just don’t taste good, full stop. The shell and tortilla just tasted like kitchen roll, and the meat was just as bad.

For a restaurant order that costs a small fortune, I expect to get what I asked for and for the food to be well prepared and enjoyable. I could genuinely make better Mexican food at home and open up my own food chain. That shouldn’t be the case when ordering from a restaurant. If this is how food is going out the door, then changes seriously need to be made. New business or not, customers aren’t test dummies. If you’re asking people to spend their money here, the bare minimum is that the food is hot, complete, and actually resembles what was ordered. Very disappointing

review_text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️ 3 stars
Our visit to Coqbull Limerick today was disappointing in several key areas.
Upon being seated, we were placed at a table that had visible dirt on it. Instead of cleaning it, napkins and cutlery were laid down straight away. This was unacceptable, particularly given that several other clean tables were available and remained free throughout our visit.
Menus were handed to us without any explanation of the Christmas menu or the Sunday roast. Customer service from the waiting staff was essentially non-existent from this point onward, as there was little engagement beyond taking the order.
When ordering drinks, we requested a jug of water. It did not arrive. We later requested a jug of water again, and while one was eventually brought to the table, it came without glasses.
We ordered two burgers. The buns were noticeably very cold, as though they had been refrigerated, which detracted from the quality of the meal. One burger was ordered with fries as a side, advertised at €4.50, but we were charged €5.50 instead.
No one checked on us during the meal to ask how everything was or whether we needed anything further.
The burgers themselves were average and unremarkable, with no standout flavours or elements.
The restaurant is nicely decorated for Christmas, which adds to the atmosphere, but overall the experience was not acceptable due to the lack of basic service, attention to cleanliness, and care. Improvements are clearly needed.

review_text:
First impressions: My Girlfriend and I had dinner in Texas Steakout on Jan 1st whilst staying at a nearby Hotel.
The restaurant is well presented, spacious and a nice atmosphere. Upon arriving there are a flight of stairs down to the restaurant, I imagine making it difficult for wheelchair users to attend.

Service: I called to make a reservation, imagining on new years day it would be busy. I was offered 20:00 on the phone however managed to secure a 19:30 booking using the open table app.
Upon arrival we were greeted promptly and shown to our table which was ready for us.
Once sat, we were offered the drinks menu and given a bottle of water for the table.
Service, food and drink delivery was very prompt - Almost a little too prompt as it did not really allow for any kind of settling before the next course arrived.

Food:
Drink: We both opted for a pornstar martini which arrived as you expect, garnished with a passionfruit. It was a good cocktail.
Starters: For starter we had the loaded potato skins and the garlic mushrooms, both were nicely presented and a suitably sized portion. Both tasted great and would recommend to anyone  attending.
Mains:
For main course both my girlfriend and myself opted for the beef and chicken fajitas. These were exactly as you expect, severed on a sizzle platter and a generous amount. As with most fajita dishes in restaurants the accompaniments felt a little disproportionate to the meat, however well filled wraps ensure that the three supplied tortillas can be enough, with a little left over, If I was to suggest improvements I would suggest possibly 1 more tortilla and a little larger portion of sauces to ensure there is enough for the amount of filling you receive.
Deserts:
For desert we opted for the strawberry Eton mess and the chocolate chip cookie jar. Both were great deserts and a suitably sized portion for a third course. Both were presented well, however the "cookie jar" wasn't what you expect with it being served in a glass "bowl" rather than a jar, however this did not take away from it being a nice desert.

Atmosphere: on New years day evening the restaurant was busy however not at capacity. there was a good amount of space between tables a noise level that allowed for easy talking without having to shout over other noise.
The restaurant was nicely decorated with beef references adorning the walls, however not to a level of tacky, it was nice. Also with it being the festive season there was still Christmas decorations up which whilst being festive also didn't go over board.

Final notes: Great restaurant with good food and good service, would recommend to anyone in the area.

I booked a room and reserved a table in restaurant for Friday Jan 2nd.

On Monday Jan 5th, I received an email thanking me forJan 2nd booking & hoped I was well rested & enjoyed my stay and requested feedback
Very annoyed that hotel can send automated emails for reviews but no reminders for booking.

Emailed hotel with feedback, acknowledged my email but no positive outcome.

Very expensive cost on New Years weekend.

review_text:
We were on a ‘walkabout’ in Limerick, it was my partner’s birthday weekend and we wanted some casual lunch and a bottle of something bubbly to celebrate. Having attended a wonderful wedding at No 1 Pery Square we decided to revisit.

It’s a quirky luxury boutique kinda feel when you enter into the pink and green interior festooned with everlasting floral arrangements, panelled walls and contemporary furniture.

We settled in the bar with the groups of ladies on brunch and residents from the hotel getting ‘tucked in’ to the cocktail list.

The friendly and sartorial team looked after us with aplomb. We were recommended and  enjoyed a bottle of the pink Cremant €58 - very good value and delicious.

Beetroot Gravlax with citrus, small cubes of cucumber jelly served with stout bread, tomato soup and home made fat chips… YUM - Who doesn’t like a ‘picky’ lunch with chips and bubbles? Demolished in no time!

There is more substantial plates upon the menu and what looked like a delightful afternoon tea being served around us and quite possibly at some point we will be back to partake.

A very nice afternoon was spent plus we dodged the rain… Total win win.

Lovely

review_text:
Whenever I visit during the summer, I always make sure to stop by Flanagan’s on the Lake in Ballina Quay, Tipperary, Ireland. It's such a lovely restaurant — the food is always delicious, and the view of the lake makes the experience even more special. The staff are really nice and welcoming, which adds to the overall great experience.

I absolutely loved the salad — fresh leafy greens with sweet roasted pecans, creamy goat cheese, beetroot, and their own in-house dressing. It’s simple, but the flavors are so well balanced and refreshing. A real standout!

Another highlight was the garlic and cheese pizza with a gluten-free base. It was perfectly crispy and packed with flavor — a real treat!

The roast beef was incredibly tender, served warm with a rich, flavorful sauce and perfectly cooked vegetables — not overdone, just right.

And the desserts! The mango and yuku cream brûlée was light and delicious. I also enjoyed the apple crumble served with custard, ice cream, and fresh fruits — comforting and so satisfying.

Highly recommend this place if you're in the area — great food, friendly staff, and a beautiful lakeside view!
